title: david678345
author: david678345
content: What platforms do you use to have multiple charts on the same computer screen? so I don't have to visit each currency pair one by one.Is there a free option?

comments.author: Oshosondy
comments.body: I have not used Tradingview before but I have heard people saying that it support what you are looking for, to view multiple charts at once on the same device. On exchanges like Binance, they can support up to 4 charts or so on computer.

comments.author: palle11
comments.body: If I understand you well, having multiple chart of pairs you want to monitor at same time I think you can do that using your computer also. You can minimise the screen for each pair and you can monitor them. I hope that is what you are referring to because I do that myself if I don't want to close a chart totally.

comments.author: bittraffic
comments.body: Metatrader software does have BTC/USD pair on it. This is what FX traders use. I tried searching for it again just to put it here https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6EFXviQJPWwI'm hoping one day a crypto exchange will really be using this to integrate cryptocurrencies but so far I can only see BTC. With it though you can see 1hr-4hr chart, daily, weekly and monthly at the same time which is quite helpful in 3 ducks trading system.Metatrader can display 4 charts at once but it will be smaller especially if you have a small screen monitor.  What people may suggest is to buy VGA splitter and connect 2 monitors to your computer so you'll literally have two screens.

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: Quote from: Oshosondy on August 20, 2023, 08:06:42 PMI have not used Tradingview before but I have heard people saying that it support what you are looking for, to view multiple charts at once on the same device. Tradingview only allows this if one is not using the free version.That is;Pro users = 2 charts per layoutPro+users = 4 charts per layoutPremium users = 8 charts per layoutI think cryptowat.ch might support this as well, though I haven’t used it for a while.

comments.author: noorman0
comments.body: Without an account (free): https://www.multicoincharts.comIt looks like this doesn't include remembering the last setting, you have to do it manually by saving the url every time you update your activity.Need to register (free and paid version):- https://www.cryptoview.com- https://getaurox.comThe free version also has more custom settings than the previous web, but you have to pay to unlock the full features.

comments.author: jeraldskie11
comments.body: Quote from: david678345 on August 20, 2023, 08:01:19 PMso I don't have to visit each currency pair one by one.Is there a free option?I think there's no much difference between manually visiting a pair than using multiple pair in one screen. Your just making things complicated. Multiple charts is best only for using one pair with multiple timeframe.However, this idea is not advisable for beginners in trading especially if you only have a small funds. Instead of subscribing a pro in tradingview, just add it to your funds.

comments.author: SquirrelJulietGarden
comments.body: Quote from: jeraldskie11 on August 20, 2023, 11:47:01 PMI think there's no much difference between manually visiting a pair than using multiple pair in one screen. Your just making things complicated. Multiple charts is best only for using one pair with multiple timeframe.Having multiple charts on the screen looks fantasy but it is not advisable for traders and if you are an amateur trader, it is not recommendable.Because looking at a chart too often is not good, it will affect your emotion that is a biggest enemy with a trader. Now, you are doing it with multiple charts on the screen, imagine how your emotion will change quickly but dramatically with many charts and many different price movements.QuoteHowever, this idea is not advisable for beginners in trading especially if you only have a small funds. Instead of subscribing a pro in tradingview, just add it to your funds.This is a good advice for newbie, amateur traders. Trading is not for them and the more indicators, more charts they use on the screen, the more likelihood they will make bad trading orders.

comments.author: Peanutswar
comments.body: Binance supports the use of multiple views too if you are using their application and for the web too, people separate for the each view, but for me I'm using with TradingView other people want to buy their services because it is supporting different pairs into different screens or you can adjust at your own. Quoted below is good for reference to you OP if you want to have more charts, but I guess ideal if you just focus at least 2 trade positions so you don't get FOMO to other charts.Quote from: Bitcoin_Arena on August 20, 2023, 10:45:32 PMThat is;Pro users = 2 charts per layoutPro+users = 4 charts per layoutPremium users = 8 charts per layout

comments.author: tvplus006

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: Quote from: david678345 on August 20, 2023, 08:01:19 PMWhat platforms do you use to have multiple charts on the same computer screen? so I don't have to visit each currency pair one by one.Is there a free option?Check ---> https://cryptowat.ch/There are many different options where you can add currencies to the watch list, perform all technical analysis, and even create an account and link it to the trading platforms and trade in them all from the same account. you can add, modify and divide the screen as you like.You can find a lot of results and guides if you search the internet.

comments.author: tjtonmoy
comments.body: If you use Google Chrome browser, you can create multiple tabs, make them small or big and then rearrange them according to your liking. Also, you can hide or modify each and every tab. The best advice is to have multiple screen. One for trading, one for chart and one for analysis. This will give you the best multitasking experience. You can focus on the thing that is important, and you can put others to the side which are less important. And if you really are limited to only one screen, the first option is better, I think. Being able to manage it manually will give much freedom and flow to the work.I don't like being stuck to the limit of platforms. Modify according to your preference and it will be much interesting.

comments.author: Hamza2424
comments.body: Quote from: david678345 on August 20, 2023, 08:01:19 PMWhat platforms do you use to have multiple charts on the same computer screen? so I don't have to visit each currency pair one by one.Is there a free option?Hmm, Decent topic At least it's not about copy trading haha, First of all as maximum of the fellows here are trained or you could say that newbies in trading I want to recommend you all stick to the single chart first as Pro-traders use such charts for the Quick trades and analysis. Most of the time people who use the multi-chart trading view trade in a shorter time frame.Besides that, I think most of my fellows already answered the Op with better suggestions. I would recommend TradingView for that and Binance also offers the advanced Trading View interface as well as Kraken.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: Quote from: tjtonmoy on August 27, 2023, 04:30:37 PMIf you use Google Chrome browser, you can create multiple tabs, make them small or big and then rearrange them according to your liking. Also, you can hide or modify each and every tab. There are additions to Google Chrome that enable you to divide the screen into several small screens, and with the ability to automatically update them by making the session id have a higher priority, as without that, one of the windows may not be updated by making the internet priority for another session id.There is another possibility, which is to use Excel to display the data, but why all this effort and you can use ---> https://cryptowat.ch/

But about coupling EXchange with Cryptowatch, I haven't done it yet because this is my first experience and whether or not it is safe to connect to my personal exchange.

comments.body: Quote from: hugeblack on August 29, 2023, 12:03:06 PMQuote from: tjtonmoy on August 27, 2023, 04:30:37 PMIf you use Google Chrome browser, you can create multiple tabs, make them small or big and then rearrange them according to your liking.
